title: Wickersley Woods Walking Route

images.title: Paul Eggleston / Wickersley  Woods.
images.caption: Wickersley Woods. Woodland with a documented history back to 1600 and once a source of charcoal for the emerging local steel smelting industry. Now leased by Wickersley Parish Council and managed with advice from the Forestry Commission. Winner of Best Woodland in Yorkshire award 2007.

images.title: Paul Eggleston / Wickersley Woods - access path from Wood Lane.
images.caption: Wickersley

images.title: Cricket Field, Wickersley by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cricket Field, in the village

images.title: The Three Horseshoes, Wickersley by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Three Horseshoes in the village

description: This walk visits Wickersley Woods in South Yorkshire near Rotherham. The small wood is located on the southern side of the village. There's some nice easy trails with some attractive wood carvings to see on the way. The woods are popular with local dog walkers. The Rotherham Round Walk runs just to the west of the woods. You could pick up this long distance waymarked footpath to further explore the area. Head west would take you towards Rymarsh and Rotherham.
